intro: Chromolaena glaberrima, commonly known as the rough chromolaena, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are lanceolate, rough to the touch, and often have a bluish-green hue. Chromolaena glaberrima is known for its adaptability to various soil types and its ability to thrive in disturbed habitats.
